{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3363366,"name":"Logan Ackroyd ","username":"Logan_cad","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/logan_cad/{size}/224251_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-16T03:51:08.667Z","cooked":"

Hello teams ! I‚Äôm Logan a designer for team 3044 0xbe4. Our design team is looking for insight on the Cad program Onshape. This past year our team of 4 designers used inventor 2024 and while it has its pros it is a big app with too much of a learning curve for new members. Recently we have looked into using Onshape (mainly for its ability to co work with others). We want to hear feedback from teams who have used onshape in the past on whether or not we should make the switch.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":52,"updated_at":"2024-04-16T03:51:41.893Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1662,"reads":945,"readers_count":944,"score":8494.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":463034,"topic_slug":"pros-and-cons-of-onshape","display_username":"Logan Ackroyd ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65987,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Drive Coach"},"post_url":"/t/pros-and-cons-of-onshape/463034/1","custom_user_title":"Drive Coach","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3363368,"name":"Joe Schmo","username":"GenericUserPerson","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/13edae/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-16T04:00:28.836Z","cooked":"

Onshape and Inventor are pretty similar, frankly, but Onshape has more FRC-focused features like MKcad, Krayoncad, and featurescripts that just make things a lot easier, not to mention the low barrier to entry it demands being cloud based and much better collaboration and version control.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":52,"updated_at":"2024-04-16T04:00:40.357Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":928,"readers_count":927,"score":400.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":463034,"topic_slug":"pros-and-cons-of-onshape","display_username":"Joe Schmo","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":18}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58757,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot Connoisseur"},"post_url":"/t/pros-and-cons-of-onshape/463034/2","custom_user_title":"Robot Connoisseur","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":14},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":18,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3363371,"name":"Brendan Manning","username":"BrendanManning","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/67e7ee/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-16T04:03:42.764Z","cooked":"

My team switched to OnShape my junior year. I wasn‚Äôt super involved in CAD my first two years, but I had taken my high school‚Äôs CAD design course which used Inventor. The switch was relatively painless and definitely made it much easier to collaborate/access old files. It also made it easier to access CAD when I was the main designer because going between my personal laptop/school laptop/the shop computer was very seamless. We still had some trouble really getting people to the point they were contributing to the design, but I‚Äôm pretty sure we had more people at least exposed to it while using OnShape. I think the only functionality we really lost was CAM which we were still using Inventor for, but all that really required was having Inventor on the shop computer and it really wasn‚Äôt much of a delay to download a part file and pull it into Inventor. I would heavily encourage switching to OnShape.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":52,"updated_at":"2024-04-16T04:03:42.764Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":891,"readers_count":890,"score":318.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":463034,"topic_slug":"pros-and-cons-of-onshape","display_username":"Brendan Manning","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":8}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53971,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"NEU; 4761, 777 Alumni"},"post_url":"/t/pros-and-cons-of-onshape/463034/3","custom_user_title":"NEU; 4761, 777 Alumni","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":8}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":8,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3363429,"name":"Justin Chau","username":"justin.chau","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/justin.chau/{size}/120432_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-16T09:11:01.365Z","cooked":"

As an originally SolidWorks user, I found OnShape to be pretty intuitive after a day or so. Part studios and being able to design multiple parts within one are super powerful, as are the assembly context features. There are some annoyances like no assembly mirroring, random slow-downs/potential throttling, no full equivalent to ‚Äúcopy with mates‚Äù, etc. However, you also gain a lot: cross platform, more up-to-date CAD library with MKCAD, FeatureScripts. Imo, for the majority of FRC teams, OnShape is the way to go.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":52,"updated_at":"2024-04-16T09:11:01.365Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":755,"readers_count":754,"score":261.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":463034,"topic_slug":"pros-and-cons-of-onshape","display_username":"Justin Chau","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":7}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28208,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"IHOT Robotics (1414) Mechanical Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/pros-and-cons-of-onshape/463034/4","custom_user_title":"IHOT Robotics (1414) Mechanical Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":7,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3363506,"name":"Ian Osborn","username":"Sands","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/22d042/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-16T12:40:56.727Z","cooked":"
justin.chau:

‚Äúcopy with mates‚Äù

If you select multiple parts that have existing mate constraints, those constraints will be carried over to the new copy.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":52,"updated_at":"2024-04-16T12:40:56.727Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":681,"readers_count":680,"score":241.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":463034,"topic_slug":"pros-and-cons-of-onshape","display_username":"Ian Osborn","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52040,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/pros-and-cons-of-onshape/463034/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3363507,"name":"Ian Osborn","username":"Sands","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/22d042/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-16T12:43:06.876Z","cooked":"
justin.chau:

Part studios and being able to design multiple parts within one are super powerful

IMHO, this is Onshape‚Äôs ‚Äúkiller app‚Äù feature. It allows for fast design of multiple parts that need to be parametric.

Other bonus is that it runs in a browser so we can side-step school computer restrictions. The relatively intuitive interface makes a fast learning curve for school kids as well.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":52,"updated_at":"2024-04-16T12:43:06.876Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":631,"readers_count":630,"score":216.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":463034,"topic_slug":"pros-and-cons-of-onshape","display_username":"Ian Osborn","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52040,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/pros-and-cons-of-onshape/463034/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3363509,"name":"Chun-che Lo","username":"Attention","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/attention/{size}/65287_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-16T12:49:58.391Z","cooked":"

Copy with mates in onshape is the replicate feature in assembly studios.

Still a little finicky to get correct however.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":52,"updated_at":"2024-04-16T12:49:58.391Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":582,"readers_count":581,"score":116.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":463034,"topic_slug":"pros-and-cons-of-onshape","display_username":"Chun-che Lo","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":28208,"username":"justin.chau","name":"Justin Chau","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/justin.chau/{size}/120432_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28264,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Currently Job Hunting"},"post_url":"/t/pros-and-cons-of-onshape/463034/8","custom_user_title":"Currently Job Hunting","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3363526,"name":"","username":"pigrammer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pigrammer/{size}/234083_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-16T13:29:47.591Z","cooked":"

As a member of the programming subteam, I can say that Onshape is great for those not on the CAD subteam. (Granted that we haven‚Äôt used any other program since I‚Äôve joined). The ability to easily look at the design from anywhere when programming for it is invaluable.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":52,"updated_at":"2024-04-16T13:29:47.591Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":550,"readers_count":549,"score":175.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":463034,"topic_slug":"pros-and-cons-of-onshape","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64857,"hidden":false,"trust_level":3,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"246 Software Lead"},"post_url":"/t/pros-and-cons-of-onshape/463034/9","custom_user_title":"246 Software Lead","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3363528,"name":"Alex Kalinin","username":"sherplung","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sherplung/{size}/216476_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-16T13:31:30.609Z","cooked":"

As someone who came from Fusion (as a hobbyist, and only the part studio features), the transition to Onshape was pretty painless. The most significant difference was the UI, but that was easy to get acquainted with through the tried-and-true strategy of screwing around and finding out. I agree with @GenericUserPerson about the benefits of MKcad, Krayoncad, and other user-made tools for assisting in making good and quick CAD, they really are invaluable.
On top of that, Onshape gets a handful of new features about every month. They are usually pretty minor, but when looking at the update notes you often think ‚Äúman, that would have been really helpful if I had it a couple months ago.‚Äù The updates are small, but always significant.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":52,"updated_at":"2024-04-16T13:31:30.609Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":537,"readers_count":536,"score":127.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":463034,"topic_slug":"pros-and-cons-of-onshape","display_username":"Alex Kalinin","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64126,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":" FRC 1466 Webb Robotics | CAD"},"post_url":"/t/pros-and-cons-of-onshape/463034/10","custom_user_title":" FRC 1466 Webb Robotics | CAD","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3363534,"name":"Jack","username":"JackOutTheBox","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jackoutthebox/{size}/161568_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-16T13:39:14.722Z","cooked":"

There‚Äôs a few reasons why I like Onshape

  • You can run it on students‚Äô Chromebooks, allowing for working on CAD anywhere with internet and makes referencing CAD files when making parts super simple
  • There are a lot of FRC focused apps and featurescripts, like MKCad annd pulley generators
  • The collaboration features with versioning and multiple people being able to work on parts and assemblies at the same time is super useful

So far the only big downsides for us when compared to Inventor besides learning the differences between the two is that Onshape doesn‚Äôt have CAM yet, but they are working on adding it, and with big assemblies the load time can be quite long.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":52,"updated_at":"2024-04-16T13:39:14.722Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":501,"readers_count":500,"score":135.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":463034,"topic_slug":"pros-and-cons-of-onshape","display_username":"Jack","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.onshape.com/en/features/cam-studio","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"CAM Studio | Onshape","clicks":21}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50081,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 1787 - Lead Goober"},"post_url":"/t/pros-and-cons-of-onshape/463034/11","custom_user_title":"FRC 1787 - Lead Goober","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3363563,"name":"CEF","username":"CEF","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/35a633/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-16T14:21:15.680Z","cooked":"

We use OnShape. The learning curve is not very steep. You can learn the basics in a few hours, but it‚Äôs powerful, so you‚Äôre always learning something new. And, they have learning pathways to help you (and your students) along the way.

For teams, it‚Äôs accessible on most systems that students will have available, even lowly chromebooks (but don‚Äôt expect great responsiveness there), the licensing is easy, there‚Äôs no massive software installation, and because it‚Äôs all web-based it‚Äôs very easy for students to work on the same project at the same time.

PLUS, there are a lot of tools and support specifically targeted to FRC.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":52,"updated_at":"2024-04-16T14:21:15.680Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":472,"readers_count":471,"score":124.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":463034,"topic_slug":"pros-and-cons-of-onshape","display_username":"CEF","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28649,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/pros-and-cons-of-onshape/463034/12","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3363573,"name":"Duncan Macdonald","username":"Duncan_Macdonald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/duncan_macdonald/{size}/2042_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-16T14:43:04.002Z","cooked":"

We‚Äôve used them all, including a few ‚Äúuse what you‚Äôre most comfortable with‚Äù years to make the CAD team more inviting. Onshape won out.

Pros:

  • Works on underpowered student hardware
  • Collaboration/version management is included

Con:

  • You‚Äôre cooked if your less-than-professional school IT department takes the network down for updates without notice on a Saturday.
","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":52,"updated_at":"2024-04-16T14:43:04.002Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":437,"readers_count":436,"score":222.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":463034,"topic_slug":"pros-and-cons-of-onshape","display_username":"Duncan Macdonald","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":9}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6295,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"üá®üá¶"},"post_url":"/t/pros-and-cons-of-onshape/463034/13","custom_user_title":"üá®üá¶","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":8},{"id":"laughing","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":10,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3363760,"name":"Saber_8871","username":"tyron256","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tyron256/{size}/177261_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-16T18:10:51.129Z","cooked":"

Our team uses it and likes it mostly for the ability for more that one designer to contribute at once. it being browser based also allows students with less than capable hardware at home to work from home when they want to. The students also like the ability to spot check measurements on their phones before proceeding with manual machining.

that being said it does require internet and ive found that it doesnt necessarily like certain hardware configurations (seems like the more capable the hardware the less onshape is, might be resource allocation issues).

Unless I missed a very significant feature, when you articulate things in an assembly, objects can move straight through each other rather than stopping when they would interfere in real life.

","post_number":17,"post_type":1,"posts_count":52,"updated_at":"2024-04-16T19:01:35.068Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":16,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":354,"readers_count":353,"score":75.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":463034,"topic_slug":"pros-and-cons-of-onshape","display_username":"Patrick Freivald","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":52538,"username":"Loki","name":"Neel M","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/loki/{size}/203060_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7547,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC Mentor at Large"},"post_url":"/t/pros-and-cons-of-onshape/463034/17","custom_user_title":"FRC Mentor at Large","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3363795,"name":"Phil Szymanowski","username":"Cyberphil","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cyberphil/{size}/161083_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-16T19:14:53.577Z","cooked":"

This is no different than pretty much every other major CAD software out there. You can put limits on every mate you want though which manually accomplishes the same thing but isn‚Äôt completely parametric.

Onshape and other softwares also have interference check functions where you can put the assembly in a position and check if it interferes with other components in the assembly.

","post_number":18,"post_type":1,"posts_count":52,"updated_at":"2024-04-16T19:16:05.018Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":17,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":351,"readers_count":350,"score":245.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":463034,"topic_slug":"pros-and-cons-of-onshape","display_username":"Phil Szymanowski","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":7547,"username":"pfreivald","name":"Patrick Freivald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pfreivald/{size}/177405_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":12}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":10874,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 272 (Cyber Crusaders), FTC 23598 (Robotic Pretzles)"},"post_url":"/t/pros-and-cons-of-onshape/463034/18","custom_user_title":"FRC 272 (Cyber Crusaders), FTC 23598 (Robotic Pretzles)","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":9},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":12,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3363839,"name":"Justin","username":"Aleejan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/c2a13f/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-16T19:48:58.132Z","cooked":"

Having used Fusion 360 for FRC and onshape for a different robotics competition, the biggest pro for me in onshape was by far the version control. Being able to work on different branches at the same time is very useful if you have multiple team members working on the same parts and/or mechanisms. It being accessible on any computer is great as well.

","post_number":19,"post_type":1,"posts_count":52,"updated_at":"2024-04-16T19:48:58.132Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":341,"readers_count":340,"score":138.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":463034,"topic_slug":"pros-and-cons-of-onshape","display_username":"Justin","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50457,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/pros-and-cons-of-onshape/463034/19","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3364037,"name":"Logan Ackroyd ","username":"Logan_cad","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/logan_cad/{size}/224251_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-17T02:02:24.689Z","cooked":"

Thank you, teams, for responding to this post. We had a meeting tonight, during which another design member and I reviewed Onshape and its apps, such as Mkcad. We believe it will be beneficial for us to switch from Inventor to Onshape. Thank you for helping us make this decision, and we hope to keep you updated throughout the offseason.

","post_number":20,"post_type":1,"posts_count":52,"updated_at":"2024-04-17T02:02:44.474Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":316,"readers_count":315,"score":248.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":463034,"topic_slug":"pros-and-cons-of-onshape","display_username":"Logan Ackroyd ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":12}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65987,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Drive Coach"},"post_url":"/t/pros-and-cons-of-onshape/463034/20","custom_user_title":"Drive Coach","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":12}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":12,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3364060,"name":"Larry Bolan","username":"ratdude747","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ratdude747/{size}/4173_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-17T02:50:45.174Z","cooked":"

Inventor can do this too, but it uses a lot of CPU and can be glitchy. I rarely use it. Call me a lazy engineer, but since the stuff I design for work (not unlike FRC) is often one-off parts, I give things a quick lookover as a full assembly and call it good. If there is a slight interference that I can‚Äôt see, usually it‚Äôs nothing a die grinder (or shims) and a retroactive CAD tweak can‚Äôt fix. For the things I design that are mass-produced in some way (usually custom consumable parts), this is why the first order is always a small trial batch‚Ä¶ sometimes the new design fits like a glove, other times‚Ä¶ not so much!
